article.description:
Bonzi Wells scored 21 points and Rasheed Wallace had 18 as the Portland Trail Blazers won their 12th straight game, defeating the slumping New Jersey Nets 82-73 Friday
night.
article.headline: Trail Blazers win 12th straight game
article.linkText: Nets still weak vs. West, drop third straight to Blazers
article.story:
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- When the Portland Trail Blazers were losing, first-year coach Maurice Cheeks often was sullen and defensive after games. A 12-game winning streak has made Cheeks' smile a fixture around the Rose Garden. "Who would have ever thunk it? I certainly wouldn't have thunk it, and they certainly wouldn't have thunk it, and I'm sure you certainly wouldn't have thunk it," he said, unintentionally quoting Dizzy Dean. "But we try not to talk about it. We have much further to go than winning 12 games." Bonzi Wells scored 21 points and Rasheed Wallace had 18 as the Blazers defeated the slumping New Jersey Nets 82-73 Friday night. The Blazers haven't been on a run like this since the final month of the 1990-91 season, when they won a franchise-best 16 straight. While that team had the league's best record, this one is more of a surprise, climbing from 10th place in the Western Conference to sixth by winning 25 of 31 games. The winning streak matches Sacramento for the longest in the league this season. "A lot of (people) probably weren't thinking about the Trail Blazers, thinking we were a bunch of crazy cats up here and we can't play," Wells said," but these last 12 games really showed guys that we've got it together." Kenyon Martin scored 19 points, Kerry Kittles had 16 and Jason Kidd added 10 points and seven assists for New Jersey, the Eastern Conference leaders. But the Nets are 0-3 on a Western road trip that ends Saturday in Seattle, and they have dropped five out of six and 10 of 17. "We're just running into buzzsaws right now," Nets coach Byron Scott said. Derek Anderson hit three 3-pointers for Portland, which pulled away from a 53-all tie in the third quarter. Anderson's first long jumper beat the shot clock to make it 65-57 late in the period. Portland committed 21 turnovers, but outrebounded the Nets 47-32. "That was the worst," Martin said. "That ain't gonna win the game." New Jersey didn't get closer than five in the fourth quarter. Anderson hit two more 3s, and another from Scottie Pippen made it 76-68 with 6:12 left. Pippen, who had 12 points, hit a 23-foot jumper that extended the lead to 80-70 with 3:28 left. Portland committed 21 turnovers but outrebounded the Nets 47-32. To show how much the league has changed since the Blazers won 16 straight 11 years ago, they averaged 114.1 points during that streak; in the current one, they're averaging 94.8. "Defensively, we're just laying it all out on the line, and that's been the key to our success so far," Pippen said. "Any time you're on a winning streak, you want it to last forever, and it does remind me that if we can keep this up it's an opportunity for us to win a title." The Nets tied their longest losing skid of the season, but to put their breakout year in perspective, last season they had seven losing streaks of three games or more. That included two strings of seven defeats and one of nine straight. "Every team's going to go through its bumps during the season," Kidd said. "For us, it's been three games, then two games, then we find a way to win. We've got to come out tomorrow and find a way to win." Game notes
Former Oregon quarterback Joey Harrington played the national anthem beautifully on the piano. He watched the game courtside next to Ducks coach Mike Bellotti, who had the most exclusive view in the house -- in Paul Allen's seat, beside Blazers GM Bob Whitsitt. ... The Blazers have been outrebounded only twice in the last 15 games, leading the category by an average of 8.5. ... The Nets have lost six straight in Portland and 14 of 15, falling to 3-24 here overall.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
